rules.prover9_expression: (submits(agency, proposal) -> (-(recommends(advisor, research) -> approves(committee, research)) -> rejects(committee, research)))
rules.natural: Whenever the agency submits the proposal, if it is not the case that recommending the research by the advisor implies committee approval, then the committee rejects the research.
If the scientist studies the phenomenon, then a natural phenomenon occurs in the region.
Under the condition that the technician monitors the phenomenon, a natural phenomenon occurs in the region.
If the researcher is employed by the institute, then they are assigned to the project.
Either the researcher is employed by the institute or the consultant is contracted by it.
Whenever the consultant is contracted by the institute, the technician monitors the phenomenon.
Under the condition that the inspector investigates the facility, the industry violates the regulation.
Whenever the report publishes findings, the company implements measures.
Either the report publishes findings or an earthquake occurs in the region.
If the inspector audits the facility, then, provided the researcher is assigned to the project, the scientist studies the phenomenon.
Provided that the inspector is certified by the agency, they investigate the facility.
Under the condition that the inspector is trained by the agency, they audit the facility.
Either the facility operates legally or the inspector is certified by the agency or they are trained by it.
If the industry complies with the law, then the research is permitted in the ecosystem.
If the company follows guidelines, then the industry complies with the law.

rules.prover9_expression: (monitors(agency, compliance) -> (enforces(regulator, standard) -> (adopts(industry, standard) -> (implements(company, measures) -> follows(company, guidelines)))))
rules.natural: Under the condition that the agency monitors compliance, then, if the regulator enforces the standard, industry adoption implies that company measures lead to guideline adherence.
If an earthquake occurs in the region, then a natural phenomenon occurs in the region.
Provided that the agency reviews reports, they monitor compliance.
If the agency is authorized for monitoring, then they are authorized to conduct research.
Under the condition that a storm occurs in the region, a natural phenomenon occurs in the region.
Provided that the industry submits the report, then either the agency operates legally or they are authorized for monitoring or a storm occurs in the region.
If the company violates emission limits, then they exceed them.
Under the condition that the agency sanctions the company, they penalize it.
If the research is permitted in the ecosystem, then the agency is authorized to conduct it.
Provided that the inspector is authorized for the investigation, the agency investigates the violation.
Either the inspector is authorized for the investigation or they are assigned to it.
If the inspector is assigned to the investigation, then, if it is not the case that company violation implies non-exceeding of limits, the agency sanctions the company.
Under the condition that the committee approves the publication, they approve the research.
Provided that the NGO challenges the censorship, the agency does not censor the publication.
If the NGO protests the censorship, then the agency does not censor the publication.
Under the condition that the public supports the NGO, then either the NGO challenges the censorship or protests it.
Either the government approves the censorship or the public supports the NGO.
Provided that the court opposes the censorship, the government does not approve it.
Provided that the researcher plagiarizes the work, they do not credit the source.
Either the journal authenticates the paper or, if the researcher plagiarizes the work, they credit the source.
If the journal rejects the paper, then they do not authenticate it.
Provided that the peer recommends the paper, they endorse it.
Either the author appeals the decision or they do not dispute the rejection.
Provided that the commission penalizes the agency, the agency violates the protocol.
Either the auditor is certified by the board or they are licensed by it.
Under the condition that the auditor is licensed by the board, then either the inspector is certified by the agency or they are trained by it.
Either the facility operates illegally or, if the auditor is certified by the board, then either the inspector is certified by the agency or they are trained by it.
Provided that the agency shuts down the facility, it does not operate illegally.

rules.prover9_expression: (investigates(regulator, industry) -> (-(-(violates(industry, regulation) | (assigned(researcher, project) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> -operates(industry, legally)) -> complies(industry, regulation)))
rules.natural: If the regulator investigates the industry, then, if it is not the case that either industry violates regulation or project assignment leads to phenomenon study implies non-legal operation, the industry complies with the regulation.
Either the regulator investigates the industry or they audit it.
Provided that the regulator audits the industry, they inspect the facility.
If the commission fines the agency, then they penalize it.

rules.prover9_expression: (authorized(regulator, inspection) -> (inspects(regulator, facility) -> (-(-(violates(industry, regulation) | (assigned(researcher, project) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> -operates(industry, legally)) -> complies(industry, regulation))))
rules.natural: Provided that the regulator is authorized for inspection, then, if they inspect the facility, and non-violation or project study implies non-legal operation, the industry complies with the regulation.
Either the regulator is authorized for inspection or they are mandated for it.

rules.prover9_expression: (approves(council, inspection) -> (orders(commission, inspection) -> (mandated(regulator, inspection) -> (inspects(regulator, facility) -> (-(-(violates(industry, regulation) | (assigned(researcher, project) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> -operates(industry, legally)) -> complies(industry, regulation))))))
rules.natural: Under the condition that the council approves the inspection, then, if the commission orders it, and mandate leads to inspection with implications, the industry complies with the regulation.
Either the council approves the inspection or they authorize it.

rules.prover9_expression: (authorizes(council, inspection) -> (orders(commission, inspection) -> (mandated(regulator, inspection) -> (inspects(regulator, facility) -> (-(-(violates(industry, regulation) | (assigned(researcher, project) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> -operates(industry, legally)) -> complies(industry, regulation))))))
rules.natural: If the council authorizes the inspection, then, provided the commission orders it, and mandate leads to inspection with implications, the industry complies with the regulation.
Provided that it is not the case that advisor recommendation implies committee approval, the committee does not reject the research.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(violates(industry, regulation) | (assigned(researcher, project) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> operates(industry, legally))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that either industry violates regulation or project assignment leads to phenomenon study, then the industry operates legally.
Under the condition that it is not the case that report publication implies research permission, the commission fines the agency.
Provided that it is not the case that report publication implies research permission, the agency does not violate the protocol.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(submits(scientist, paper) -> (-(-occurs(natural_phenomenon, region) -> exempt(agency, review)) -> approves(committee, research))) -> plagiarizes(researcher, work))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not the case that scientist paper submission implies that non-natural phenomenon implies agency exemption leads to committee approval, the researcher plagiarizes the work.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(endorses(peer, paper) -> (recommends(advisor, research) -> approves(committee, research))) -> disputes(author, rejection))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that peer endorsement implies that advisor recommendation leads to committee approval, then the author disputes the rejection.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(employed(scientist, university) -> (employed(researcher, institute) -> studies(scientist, phenomenon))) -> resigns(scientist, position)) -> retains(university, scientist))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that non-university employment implication leads to scientist resignation, then the university retains the scientist.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(-occurs(natural_phenomenon, region) -> exempt(agency, review)) -> approves(committee, monitoring)) -> violates(company, emission_limits))
rules.natural: Provided that it is not the case that non-natural phenomenon implies agency exemption leads to committee monitoring approval, the company violates emission limits.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(-occurs(natural_phenomenon, region) -> exempt(agency, review)) -> approves(committee, publication)) -> censors(agency, publication))
rules.natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that non-natural phenomenon implies agency exemption leads to committee publication approval, the agency censors the publication.
If it is not the case that a natural phenomenon occurs in the region implies agency exemption from review, then the advisor recommends the research.
Provided that it is not the case that a natural phenomenon occurs in the region implies agency exemption from review, the committee does not approve the monitoring.
Under the condition that it is not the case that a natural phenomenon occurs in the region implies agency exemption from review, the committee does not approve the research.
